intro: Semaphyllanthe venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan semaphyllanthe, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite leaf arrangement. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical plant morphology and ecology.
